info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 11:07AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WITH REDUCED VISIBILITY WILL AFFECT LOCATIONS NEAR THE MASON-DIXON LINE THROUGH MIDDAY... At 11:00 AM, radar indicated scattered to numerous snow showers moving in an east-southeast direction at around 30 MPH in the vicinity of the West Virginia/Pennsylvania border, extending westward into portions of eastern Ohio. The main impact of these snow showers will be a quick reduction to one-half mile visibility in the heaviest snow showers. Brief wind gusts to 30 MPH are also possible. A quick coating of snow may occur on roads, but the snow will quickly melt once the heavier snow ends. Use caution if you encounter reduced visibility or slippery roads while driving. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
